Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Inevitability you are right, to think, that it's not profitable to mine Hush and immediately resell right now. Hush is not a cash crop

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is a fruit tree, that needs some care and love and then produces amazing things for a long time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Some pear trees are known to produce fruit for over 400 years. But they produced nothing for the first few years, some long-term-thinking people had to plant the tree and care for it for years, before ever seeing a return

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Just something to think about.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I would rather Hush be a fruit tree than a cash crop.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And that means a stable price instead of crazy price spikes and volatility. We are slowing increasing the value of Hush, which is much healthier than marketing gimmicks without substance, that cause the price to crash after the buzz is over

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am sorry for a lot of Indian people, that could benefit from cryptocoins. Their government rightly sees that it would lose too much control, allowing it to be legal

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```
‚Äúmine, generate, hold, sell, transfer, dispose, issue or deal in cryptocurrencies directly or indirectly.‚Äù
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is draconian, it doesn't even allow for India people to be paid in fiat to work on cryptocoins, if I read correctly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> they even made it illegal to dispose/destroy cryptocoins, kind of bizarre

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Mr_Billion> What programing language do I need to know to help design a new looking hush wallet?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Mr_Billion you don't need to know how to code to help with graphics, docs, translation, UI/UX and probably other things. Our main wallet, SilentDragon, is written in C++ and uses QT5 for graphics

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Mr_Billion> Ok thanks, I‚Äôll look into it. I want to be involved. What is the difference between the HUSHmate wallet and the SilentDragon?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> HUSHmate is designed to replace the old HUSH-Swing wallet, basically a direct replacement, to make sure people had a GUI wallet when HUSH v3 mainnet launched

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Mr_Billion> Ok I‚Äôm looking for the silent dragon wallet now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> HUSHmate is meant to be a basic wallet, and HushList features or other large features are not planned for it currently, it's meant to be a basic GUI full node wallet for people, and was our first windows wallet binary

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> SilentDragon is based on ZecWallet, and has many modern features

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and we will put all our new HushList chat + file upload/download features into SilentDragon

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> SilentDragon is currently compile-only, no binaries yet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> We are finalizing some branding, mostly. It has all the basic features for beta testers to use

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/MyHush/SilentDragon/issues

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> those 2 branding items need to be completed to make a new binary

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i also reported a few issues to our upstream, bugs in zecwallet itself

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> they are non-critical, and don't block us

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/ZcashFoundation/zecwallet/issues/140

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/ZcashFoundation/zecwallet/issues/141

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Mr_Billion we need that to look less boring

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Mr_Billion> Yes I totally agree, the user experience is just as important as the technology behind the project.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Mr_Billion> That‚Äôs why I was asking what software I needed to learn to help.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Mr_Billion> Or if I can just creat mockups of layouts and someone else can make the adjustments

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> mockups and graphics will be easier for you

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> learning linux CLI and C++ to do that is not reasonable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> graphics and icons are most useful

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> to make the UI less boring

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> rendering the UI is actually writing a lot of code, so changing the way it looks is not easy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but tweaking colors or adding images is relatively simple

Author: Gateway#3763
